node.title: More communities connecting since Covid-19 pandemic hit
node.description: An increased interest in connecting with neighbours has continued two years on from the first lockdown.

node.title: 'Politically convenient': Refugees policy changing because voters find it abhorrent - Amnesty
node.description: The Australian government has agreed to New Zealand's refugee resettlement offer purely because it is politically expedient, Amnesty says. Audio

node.title: Teachers speak out against Florida school legislation
node.description: Some of America's most highly regarded teachers are speaking out against a Florida proposal and others like it around the country.

node.title: Govt sets out plan to lift children's maths, literacy performance
node.description: The government promising more support for teachers and a new system of tests to measure children's abilities.

node.title: East Coast flooding: Road repairs focus on cut-off communities
node.description: With rain still falling in the Gisborne area after severe flooding, roading contractors are trying to repair routes to areas where residents are cut off, and detours round closed highway. Audio

node.title: Second grand jury declines to charge Deshaun Watson
node.description: Watson, who has denied all illegal conduct, still faces civil lawsuits.

node.title: U.N. votes for humanitarian access to Ukraine, demands Russian hostilities end
node.description: The General Assembly voted to demand an immediate end to attacks by Russia and create humanitarian access in Ukraine.

node.title: Hefty fines for shareholders after market manipulation, disclosure breaches
node.description: The High Court has handed out hefty fines to two shareholders in Oceania Natural after they admitted to charges of market manipulation and disclosure breaches.

node.title: Ginni Thomas and Mark Meadows texted about overturning 2020 election
node.description: CBS News and The Washington Post have obtained copies of numerous text messages exchanged between Thomas and Trump's White House chief.

node.title: TairƒÅwhiti flood damage 'will take about a year' to clean up
node.description: Tokomaru students had been back in flood-repaired classrooms for just weeks, while two residents lost a campervan they were living in while their house was fixed after last year's floods.

node.title: NZME exploring content deal with Google News
node.description: Media company NZME is looking to cut a deal with technology heavyweight Google about supplying news.

node.title: Authorities poised to act as severe weather travels down North Island
node.description: The East Coast of the North Island is assessing the damage left by severe weather overnight with even more downpours yet to come. Audio

node.title: DHBs contracting former employees 'shocking waste of taxpayers' money'
node.description: Questions are being raised whether hospitals are accurately reporting their massive spending on often highly paid contractors.

node.title: Chinese authorities may already be examining black box recorder
node.description: The Chinese agency responsible for aviation announced one of the black boxes from the flight is already en route to Beijing for analysis.

node.title: New Covid-19 plan: 'We need to get back to a life of normalcy'
node.description: National would have gone further in removing Covid-19 restrictions but backs the government. The Greens fear for the most vulnerable, and ACT fears for the economy.

node.title: Non-clinical staff step up as Wellington Hospital faces shortages
node.description: Wellington Hospital bosses and non-clinical staff have been pitching in to help as staffing shortages hit.

node.title: U.S. announces charges against Russians in global hacking campaigns
node.description: Justice Department officials said that one of the campaigns, if successful, would have given Russia the ability to disrupt energy sector computer systems "at a future time of its choosing."

node.title: Phoenix finally set come home
node.description: The Wellington Phoenix men's football side will get to play at home for the first time in almost a year with confirmation of the remainder of the A League football season draw.

node.title: Dutch cricketer still wants to play for New Zealand
node.description: Logan van Beek will turn out for the Netherlands against the Black Caps but still holds ambitions of one day playing for New Zealand.

node.title: Mitch McConnell says he opposes Ketanji Brown Jackson's nomination
node.description: McConnell said Jackson's sentencing record in child pornography cases is "troubling."

node.title: How the U.S. and allies can freeze Russian gold
node.description: Vladimir Putin has stockpiled more than $100 billion in gold reserves for Russia since he invaded Crimea in 2014. Now, it's a target of Western sanctions for his Ukraine war.

node.title: These states are planning tax rebate checks to counter inflation
node.description: Georgia residents will soon receive up to $500 in a rebate check. Other states want to follow suit.

node.title: Driver killed after hitting 11-foot alligator on Florida road
node.description: John Hopkins, 59, was driving about 30 miles east of Tampa when the front of his car struck the alligator.

node.title: Wellington's fluoride fail
node.description: The Detail - How did Wellington Water fail to fluoridate much of its water supply for months on end - and why didn't it tell anyone?

node.title: House January 6 committee considering contempt for two more Trump aides
node.description: The committee had subpoenaed both Peter Navarro and Daniel Scavino, who both have declined to appear before the committee.

node.title: Covid-19 changes: 'We felt safe before, and now we don't feel safe'
node.description: Some of the country's most at-risk people say the government is trading off their safety by easing restrictions so soon.

node.title: 6 takeaways from Ketanji Brown Jackson's Supreme Court hearings
node.description: Jackson endured nearly 24 hours of questions from the Senate Judiciary Committee's 22 members over a two-day span.

node.title: Russia's economy is crumbling even as stock market reopens
node.description: Global response to the attack on Ukraine will wipe out 15 years' worth of Russian economic gains, experts forecast.

node.title: Uber will allow New Yorkers to hail a yellow cab from the app
node.description: After years of battles with traditional taxi companies, the ride-hail giant is bringing them into the fold.

node.title: NYC mayor allows unvaccinated athletes to play home games
node.description: The exemption paves the way for Brooklyn Nets point guard Kyrie Irving to begin playing home games again.
